result.execSummary:
The defendant Kali Marie Doyle was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Reckless Injury [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.23(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, all applicable court costs ad surcharges by 9/21/15 or a civil judgment is ordered.  Civil judgment can be taken from prison wages.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon she may never possess a firearm or body armor; and that her voting rights are suspended and she may not vote in any election until her civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kali Marie Doyle

records.addlTxt: denied for reasons stated in th order, signed and filed
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to Judge Christopher Dee, Br. 37, for review. jbs
Defendant's address:  Kali M. Doyle  #603828, REECC, 21425A Spring Street, Union Grove, WI  53182.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Letter in response to the letter from the defendant on 10-31-2017.
Letter to defendant.
Letter from defendant regarding DOC deductions.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in court with attorney Joshua Davis Uller.  Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Second Degree Reckless Injury PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.23(2)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.05, 939.63(1)(B), a Felony F.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank.

On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Second Degree Reckless Injury PTAC, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.23(2)(a), 939.50(3)(f), 939.05, 939.63(1)(B), a Felony F.   Defense counsel waived reading of the Amended Information and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.

Attorney Joshua Davis Uller in court, defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-22-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court in custody.  Attorney Joshua Davis Uller in court.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-09-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for further negotiations.  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 05-18-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Trial date is vacated cased adjourned for further negotitations.    Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 05-04-2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Motion in Limine, State's Requested Jury Instructions and State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection received and filed.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, defendant in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is in trial in another court.  Case will remain in trial posture.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for final pre-trial conference in Branch 7.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 04-10-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for final pretrial on 3.30.15 and for jury trial on 4.13.15.  Final pre-trial scheduled for 03-30-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 02-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Joshua D. Uller in court, defendant Kali Marie Doyle not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 7.  Status conference scheduled for 02-03-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in court with attorney Joshua D. Uller.  Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Brian Stott-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for January 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER TO WCS  for supervision upon release for the Repeat Intoxicated Driver Program.  
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug tests and portable breathalyzers.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: RACHEL A.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in court with attorney Calvin R. Malone.  Defendant Kali Marie Doyle in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.   Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
